name: Nicole Finley
text: LOVE the staff at JBD! Tammy, Mark, Santana, Zach— they’re all phenomenal!! I can’t walk in without leaving with something in my (or on my) hands! Such beautiful, unique pieces of jewelry and I get the most compliments on ALL of the time. And can NOT beat their prices. Highly recommend- if you’re looking for a piece or want to design a piece, Jewelry By Design should be your FIRST stop!

name: Lauren Kiskunes
text: Absolutely wonderful staff! I brought in a 15 year old necklace with a broke clasp and they fixed it on the spot in less than 5 minutes. Highly recommend

name: Madeline Morrell
text: Make sure you ask for your total for ALL work being done. I was being told prices for one, not the total for both. And have them circle and clearly state the quoted price before signing! It felt extremely sketchy and you're stuck when they surprise you with the true cost at pickup! I will never come here again. Poor communication and subpar customer service.

resp.text: Madeline Morrell Stewart, thanks for your feedback & your mailed letter. We set a high standard for ourselves in serving our clients & we're sorry that this was not met in your interaction with our business.  We strive to be as clear & transparent with itemized pricing on our service envelopes detailing parts, labor & totals along with a detailed description of work to be done as to remove any chance of surprise at pickup.  Regarding your visit, we created two separate envelopes because we provided two different services, one pair of earrings with 18k protector backs & specialty posts & one pair of earrings with 18ky screw posts & screw backs.  On each envelope, we included an in-depth description of parts & labor needed to complete your job along with the total.  Each envelope had a total written & differing totals ($257.10 & $300.70) due to different mechanisms.  We DID obtain your signature on each envelope as acknowledgement & confirmation of the details regarding the services BEFORE we proceeded.  We understand that your complaint is that our 10 yr. sales professional, Santana, did not give you "the grand total verbally".  It is very typical for a client that may want to pick up their services independently from one another, i.e.:  $257.10 one week & the $300.70 the next week.  Although we may have fallen short with "verbally" providing you with the grand total, we were completely transparent with our detailed written description & totals for each signed envelope.  We do value you as a new customer as well as your other family members & hope you will reconsider visiting Jewelry by Design in the future.

name: Leah Smith
text: Wonderful staff and customer service! They are so kind and helpful and want their customers pleased. Beautiful work and jewelry!

resp.text: HI Ms. Smith. Thank you so much for your kind words & sweet review! Thank you for your business & we look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Patty Gleeson
text:
My 1.5 ctw wedding ring was appraised at 1.24 ctw by jbd. My 2 ctw tennis bracelet was appraised by jbd at 1.45 ctw. My 5 ctw aquamarine pendant was appraised by jbd at 3 ctw. No mention of the need to remove stones to receive an accurate appraisal when I brought my pieces in. Needless to say the low carat weights greatly lowered the appraised value of my pieces. The appraisals were finished a week late. No courtesy call to let me know they wouldn't be ready on time. I called multiple times upon the scheduled ready date and after to check in on their progress. I finally
requested that they call when the pieces were ready. Overall an extremely disappointing experience. And unfortunately the appraisals are virtually worthless.

name: Crystal Landcaster
text: The customer service here is WONDERFUL! I simply cannot speak highly enough of this store! I brought in a family ring I inherited and wanted to melt it down and create a new right hand ring. When I went in, I had absolutely no idea what I wanted it to look like, I just knew I wanted a right hand ring. Other places I have been to, I would walk around and just look to get ideas, and people would get very frustrated with me or just ignore me. When I came into Jewelry by Design, and told them I didn't have any idea of a style I wanted, they were so helpful and patient and were excited to work with me and show me different pieces. It was actually fun working with them! Not to mention, being a part of the entire process and seeing it be created from beginning to end. It also made me feel so much better that they do everything right there in the store, they don't send anything off unlike other places in town. They also scoped my diamond with me to show me how to identify it so I knew it was my same diamond when I got it back. I will always recommend them to everyone! I am always treated like family when I walk in the door, I just love the feeling of a small town "local jeweler" I absolutely LOVE this place!

resp.text: Thank you so much Crystal! We truly enjoyed working with you and are so glad we got to be a part of the memories of your special ring! Creating new designs is our passion and we love to include our customers in the entire process; from beginning to end. We hope you are still enjoying your ring and we highly look forward to seeing you again soon. Thank you so much for the sweet words!

name: Alex Vroom
text: I am not a person that typically writes negative reviews but this was an experience that had to be shared. I walked into Jewelry by Design with my custom made, one of a kind engagement ring. It has 4 bands that meet in the back. My engagement ring had cracked where the bands meet and one of the bands had broken off. I still don’t know how it happened but I was devastated so I took it in to get it repaired. I took it to Jewelry by Design because of all the great reviews and because the original jeweler was now retired. When I took it in, the service was great and I also asked to resize down 1/4 size because it had been fitting loosely. My first indication that something wasn’t right should have been when they didn’t check to see if they agreed that I needed it resized. When I came back for my ring, I could no longer put it on my finger after only going down a 1/4 size and they had bent the bands causing the halo for the diamond to be out of place. It no longer looked like the same ring and the setting for the diamond was crooked. I went back to them the next day and explained that I believed somewhere in the resizing process/repair that some of the bands looked a little out of place and asked if they would be able to fix it. I also brought a picture of the ring to show how it looked originally. The jeweler at this point was incredibly rude and even asked if the picture was of the same ring. I then explained to him that it was and stated again that this was a one of a kind ring and that it did not look like the picture and also didn’t fit. He then proceeded to tell me that I had not needed to get it resized in the first place and didn’t understand why I had gotten it resized. He also said that he had only done work in the back so anything that was messed up in the front was not his doing. He walked away at this point and his sales rep picked up the conversation asking if we wanted it resized. I said yes and that I would like it fixed to look like the picture. She relunctantly asked me to send the picture to the store email. I was charged more for the resizing than I had been originally and they told me it would take a week to resize it. I should have at this point taken it elsewhere but I wanted to give them a chance to fix their mistake. A week later I got a call in which the jeweler said that he had gotten it “as close as humanly possible to the picture.” He also said that the ring was unstable and that it needed additional structural support insinuating that it was poorly designed. My fiancé picked up the ring and much to our disappointment and frustration it looked nothing like the picture. The 4 bands had originally been crossing and now they were parallel to each other. On top of that they removed the 14k gold stamp from the inside of the band. I hope that doesn't mean that they used some other metal when they resized it. I don’t know how he thought that it looked like the picture. I have shown several friends and family members the before pictures and what it looks like now and they all agree that it’s not even close. To make matters worse he added tacks to the ring saughtering the bands together. This was not part of the original design nor had we asked for it and he never called to ask before he modified the ring. The jeweler was again very rude to my fiancé when he picked up the ring making comments about how the design was unstable and insinuated the damage to the ring had been some how done by my fiancé between leaving the store and giving it back to me 10 minutes later. We believe that our poor treatment was due to our college age and that the piece was from another jeweler. The jeweler who had created our ring had designed most of my family’s engagement rings, had been in business as a family for over 80 years, and was highly respected as a master jeweler for his unique design and pieces. So to anyone who has jewelry designed by another jewler or who is young do not go to this establishment because they are extremely arrogant and have no respect for you or your jewelry.

text: I went to see Rick with some old jewelry I no longer wore & some rings passed down to me that I knew I'd never wear. I explained I have never worn a specific wedding band because over the years I've never found one that I adored enough to wear every day. Most look "typical" and I've happily worn the few pretty ones I've collected. I didn't know what I wanted,  I just knew what I didn't want. After a couple of discussions, Rick helped me realize, I had a ring from years ago that meant everything to me... the first ring my husband ever gave me. He suggested we "create" that same ring but with more of a commitment look. I couldn't be happier with the result. I had tears in my eyes when he handed it to me! Who knew the little ring I was given as a promise of hope from the beginning would mature into a lifelong dream that I can someday pass on to our only daughter!! Thank you so much for your patience and ability to realize what I really wanted all along!! I can't keep looking at it and smiling!!!! ❤

text: We went in to have something engraved and to buy a piece of jewelry for our new grandaughter.  We asked to talk with the engraver and looked at a child's bracelet while we waited. . He never came out and no one spoke to us at all. After being totally ignored by all staff members for about 20 minutes we left. I will shop somewhere else where my business is appreciated.

resp.text: Mrs. Brady I am so very sorry that you were unhappy with our in ability to get to you sooner. I apologize for that, but we were very busy when you were in the store. The engraver was already out front with a customer that arrived prior to you. When the engraver finished with the customer he was waiting on, he asked who was requesting him and you had already left. He was giving the prior customer the same attention that he was hoping to give you. We did have a shortage of staff today due to illness, I apologize. I am also sorry that you did not realize he was helping someone else, I am sure you would have understood had you realized such.  Congratulations on the arrival of your new granddaughter that is such a blessing! Again, I am sorry that our engraver could not get to you sooner. I am happy to talk with you by phone as I am hurt that you left feeling unappreciated, as that is never our desire! Please call 334-365-6552 and ask for Lynn.

name: Gisette Greene
text: While I love the ring my husband picked out, I have to say this was one of the most unpleasant experiences I’ve ever had in a retail environment. I usually don’t like to post negative reviews but after hearing from multiple people that they experienced the same from here I felt I should. I instantly felt uncomfortable when I walked in. My husband had purchased my ring and I brought it in to get resized. That was my first visit and it was okay. They said to give them at least 5 days but I should receive it back sooner. 2 days later and they called back! I was thrilled! I was surprised how quickly the turnaround was. I left but the ring was too snug. I brought it back and the entire time the young lady was assisting me she seemed like I was a nuisance. Very unpleasant and I just couldn’t wait to get the heck out of there. Again, they had a very quick turnaround and when I walked in not one word was said to me. I walked up and I almost spoke first but I wanted to see how long this would last. FIVE employees there and not one spoke a word to me. When I got up to the counter still nothing was said. She handed me my rings and finally asked how they fit. Thankfully they fit perfectly and I never have to set foot in there again. Absolutely horrible service.

resp.text: We work hard to make all feel welcome and to provide excellent service. I sounds like we failed you and I am sorry! I do hope you will give us an opportunity to help you in the future. This will give us an opportunity to review all procedures. If you would like to speak to me in person, please come by or call 334-365-6552.

text: Fantastic customer service. Do yourself a favor and visit!!!!!

name: Andrea Williams
text: I called this morning,  then decided to go in to have some engravings done. Everyone was so nice, helpful, as well as professional! I needed the engravings in connection to a birthday gift, and needed it done extremely last minute! I called several other places beforehand and was pretty much told by everyone that it was impossible to get done in the timeframe for which I needed it, and I even offered to pay a fee in order to have it rushed. The person I spoke with said that not only could they get it done within my timeframe, but also they would not charge me a fee for doing so. I thought it would take at least a day and a half, but Justin got it taken care of in just a couple hours for me. I really loved his work, and the pieces looked beautiful! I was really made to feel like I was an important customer,  and that my business was truly appreciated. I was very impressed by the pregnant lady as well as Justin, and I will definitely be recommending Brian jewelry in the future. Additionally, it will be my go to store for jewelry purchases and needs from here on out.

resp.text: Andrea, we are so happy you felt welcome and appreciated in our store! That is our great desire. We are so pleased you allowed us to help you make your birthday celebration be enhanced by our services. Also thank you for giving Justin and Kendall a shout out. We hope to see you again soon!

text: This is NOT the place to try and sell Gold at.  They offer far less than current value. Re reply: What a bunch of jokers "All of our offers are fair and honest"  Fair offer it was not.  Everyone else pays within $10 of current spot values. Crazy.

resp.text: For over 63 years Bryan Jewelry has been one of the most trusted names in jewelry in the Prattville region. While we do buy Gold, we must inspect any and all products before we purchase them, upon looking at your product it was concluded that you had bullion. For your bullion we offered 75%, which was disclosed to you before the offer was made.  For any customer we will make an offer and it's up to the customer to make the decision to sell. All of our offers are fair and honest. It is with this policy coupled with our years of experience and services that have built a legacy of integrity and trust with our customers.

name: Robin Boydstun
text:
Today 7/16/2021 we went into money miser pawn to buy an air conditioner and they had 2. We purchased the more expensive of the 2 got it home 15 minutes later to find out that it didn't blow cold or have the remote control that goes to it so we called and ask if they had the remote that we couldn't change the temp and that it blows hot. The employee after putting us on hold for awhiles aid they don't refund for merchandise but they would give us $10 to go buy a remote for it. We paid $138 to them for an air conditioner that doesn't work. I must say I am very sad that I got ripped off.
I don't recommend them at all

resp.text: Hello My name is Ken Barnes, I am the General Manager here at Money Mizer. When you called  you spoke to one of my employees that works here and asked if we had the remote. We did not have the remote. You stated that you needed the remote to change some settings on it and that you could not get it cold enough without the remote. My employee made me aware of what went on and that you were asking for a remote control that we did not have, we did place you on a brief hold so we could find the remote locally for you and offered to refund the cost of the remote as you stated you just needed the remote to change the settings. We tracked one down here locally we told you exactly where it was and the price for it and offered to refund that part of the sale to cover the cost of the remote. I am sorry if you feel like this is bad customer service if you would like to come in and see me I would be happy to speak with you about this situation.

name: Jake Livingston
text:
Rip off!!!! Was charged $120 for a USED tool bag and 5 USED hand tools. $60 for a used tool bag I later found out I could have got brand new from Home Depot for $59. Was charged and additional $60 for 5 USED NON-NAME Brand hand pliers for a total of $120.
This place is a joke a scam and a rip off, save your money go else where not only will you get better service you will get better quality and fair pricing.

resp.text: I am sorry you feel you were not treated fairly, but if you were unhappy with the price of the items that you knew were used you could have placed the items back on the shelf an not purchased them. This is a pawn shop so it should not be a surprise that most all the items for sale are used items. We check prices daily to make sure we are 30 to 50% below fair market value. Name brand items are priced accordingly.

name: Tammy Balentine
text: Absolutely the rudest pawn shop I've ever felt with! Private messages me when I gave them a Facebook review not about product but only to be rude and complain about their review! I messaged their business around 10am on sat they didn't respond till the next day being terrible towards me and my opinions,  the other businesses I messaged about my husband's new gun responded right away or at least by the end of the day.

resp.text: Rude customer, she did not appreciate us trying to honestly work through the situation of her review.  She left a review upon false information, there were never any questions that could have been answered about the "product" in the time frame she "offered."  The sad part is she could have made a short, simple phone call to avoid her situation.  Rash and ill tempered she would only see it her way. Short sidedness, a lack of understanding, and poor communication on her part lead to this review.  Her opinion is the only one that matters to her, and we cannot please someone out looking for problems.   We fulfilled our end of what we advertised.  We are thankful for our customers, their respect of our business practices, and common sense!

name: Cedric Banks
text:
Wanted to spend good money but no was interested in helping me, visited 3 times to give them a chance not to leave me with a bad impression but it was painfully clear I was not welcome, not trying to play the race card but I did not feel welcome and there was no indication of concern to help me.
Thanks for giving me the opportunity to shop else where.

resp.text: I'm sorry you feel this way Mr. Banks.  Did you ask for help?  I would like to address the situation with any employee that would refuse to help an interested customer, buying or not.  We pride ourselves in giving the best customer service we can.  If you'd like to come back in and ask for Grant, I will personally help you myself.  There are no race cards to be played up here as well Mr. Banks.  We do not interpret race that way.  Everyone is a customer, no matter the race, no matter the clothes, everyone matters.  We've been here over 25 years for a reason.

name: Bob Gohn
text: Fantastic place! You never know what you might find at Bama Pawn. The folks there are very friendly and helpful with all of your needs

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback!  We do our best!  Come back and see us!

name: Trevor Bright
text: I have been in the store multiple times and on every occasion I haven't had one employee greet me or ask of I needed help. I had great intentions of buying something but it seemed that they figured since I'm a young I'm not going to spend alot of money so there is no point in helping him...

resp.text: We're sorry for any experiences you've had where you were not greeted or helped in our store. We actually pride ourselves on our customer service and tell all of our employees to greet customers when they come and go. I'm not making an excuse but at times we do get busy either helping other customers or keeping up with all the paperwork that comes through the store so we may miss a customer here and there. But if you've been in multiple times we should have helped you. As far as judging you by your age or if you're going to spend a lot of money... we have a huge range of prices on tools, guns, and accessories. So whether you're going to spend money or not we aren't going to discriminate against you based off your age, race, gender, or even the size of your wallet. Again, we apologize that you had such bad experiences in our store but we appreciate you bringing it to our attention. Hopefully you'll come back and give us the chance to treat you differently.

name: Randy Tucker
text: They try to get rich off every sale. No customer service. Rude. Goto Tucker Pawn priceville for a great deal. I saved 119.00 on one purchase and Tuckers are great people. No relation to me but great people.

resp.text:
If this customer has been in our store, he or she has never addressed any issues with us or asked us to price match, I've never had any issues price matching Tuckers pricing, ever.  We typically compete with other stores in our radius just fine.  Academy Sport is right down the road as well.  We often get phone calls of them having to price match us.  Also, I find it odd the customer has the same last name whether they "claim" no relation or not and praise tuckers all in the same review.  Never the less, all of our other reviews speak for themselves.  It's a shame someone sink this low to jeopardize our ratings.  I hope this review speaks multitudes for the type of person this is.

Just a comparison for all you googler's out there, check out our pricing vs their pricing on Davidson's Gallery of Guns, it just proves this was a low blow and we are cheaper.

text: Open @830 on saturdays. Well 0836 and no one is here to open the store for me to get my property that has already been paid for.

resp.text: We are a mom and pop store, family emergency's can't be helped.  Nor were you in the parking lot at 8:40 AM when I arrived.  We went above and beyond to remedy your situation and we cannot help your attempt to pickup your merchandise at the last minute and late might I add. We did not have to do what we did.  Nor any of the help we've ever given to you and your family.  I do apologize for running late.  We do however appreciate the review and know where we stand after years of business based on one instance, and not all the other smooth transactions we have shared together.  I do not understand the rash decision to sacrifice a relationship over a temper tantrum, a personal mistake, and 10 minutes. - Grant C, Management

text: I just have to brag on the guys at Jewelry Express in the Quintard mall. I went in there at about 1:30 today and they said they could do it before they close today. I told them i had to work at 4 and may not be able to pick it up unless they let me take a break at work and they said they would go ahead and do it next so i could get it done before i go into work and they had it resized perfectly by 3:00! It was only $30 and it looks brand new. You can’t even tell anything was done to it. These guys are awesome and i highly recommend them!

text: I had four watches that had dead batteries. I was able to get them all replaced in just 20minutes and it was a great deal at $9 each! text: Have had several watch batteries replaced and a ring repaired. Very friendly and affordable.

text: I have used Jewelry Repair Center for 9 years, to date. Replaced watch batteries, tightened ring prongs, cleaned very valuable jewelry, and sized my wife's wedding ring. All well done, with reasonable prices and within a very reasonable time frame. Nice people. I highly recommend them to you. NOTE: They also sell jewelry!!

name: Harmomy Vollmer
text: Great service. Great price. Fixed a family heirloom.

name: Nestor J. Delgado
text: Careless, irresponsible, poor service. Brought my brand new watch for band adjustment (remove links) and ended up with lots of scratches. Do not recommend.

name: Dana Trammell
text: I got a new Effy ring for Christmas but it needed sizing. It was a 7 and several places wanted to send it off for 3 plus weeks and other places were astronomical in price. I found this place and they do their service in house. It usually takes a couple of days for sizing. I tried on the ring sizes and settled on a 5 but when I tried it on was disappointed and wanted it bigger. I told the guy it was just too tight and I would be glad to pay extra but just needed it right. He asked if a 5 and 1/4 would work and I thought it would. He got me to come back in a couple of hours and it was perfect! He didn’t charge me any extra at all. These guys are very professional, fast, efficient, and know everything about jewelry and their prices are the best in town! Believe me, I went to them all. This will be my go to place from now on. I highly recommend this place.

name: Daniel Flynn
text: Got a watch as a wedding gift a couple years back and have never worn it. Decided it was time, but I had to get links removed. Then found out the battery had stopped. Took it here and they replaced the battery and the links within 10 minutes(was told by another company that I would have to ship it off and it would take 3 weeks or so to get back). So 10 minutes, and 17 dollars later, my watch was fitting and working. Can't beat that.

text: I’ve gone to Matt and Dave several times throughout the years, they’ve  fixed necklaces for me, watches for my husband and I’ve even bought a couple pieces from them. Always great business and fair prices. 10/10

text: Great people!  Very honest.  Always helpful.  Highly recommend them.

name: The Stig
text: I have done business with David and Matt many times for everything from removing links from watch bands to sizing rings to replacing lost diamonds. Every time without fail they have been nothing less than spectacular! They are honest, friendly and do very high quality work which they stand behind. They are more than fair with their pricing which keeps people coming back and referring others. I highly recommend them to anyone needing any type of jewelry repair.

name: Ron B
text:
I've used these guys on more than one occasion. Once to replace the crystal and battery on my Fossil watch, and they were also able to polish the links to bring it back to life. Again to purchase two wedding bands, and to have the stone placed in the setting of an engagement ring. And another for the repair of two rings that involved reforming the ring to size and replacing a few stones.

All three times the two guys working the counter were nothing more than helpful. I saw where someone said that they were intimidating. I am 6'5" and the owner was a little bigger than me, so if they were insecure about themselves, then maybe but they were friendly on the phone and in person and talked to me no different than they might a friend. So if personable and joking customer service isn't your thing then maybe they're not for you. But the price was right and the work and service was great.

name: Tina Simmons
text: Great, Great work...Would definitely refer a friend

name: Youlunda Haygood
text: Friendly staff and great prices on repair, batteries, and ring sizing, and very fast. I had an excellent experien and highly recommend them.

name: W.J. Carpenter
text: Let me start off by saying that if you need a watch repaired, look no further than Jewelry Repair Center. With no appointment, I walked in, presented the staff with my broken watch (which they'd never repaired before), and within 10 minutes, my watch was working again. The entire staff is incredibly professional, extremely talented, very pleasant, and eager to serve. I won't say how much the repair cost me, but I will say that their amazing generosity not only surprised me, but completely humbled me (particularly given this strained economic time in which we're living). A big thanks to the staff at JRC; you all really made my day.

name: Jay Dub
text: Huntsville's hidden gem! Unparalleled customer service! Big thanks to Matthew for stopping everything he was doing to assist me! (Been looking for a jeweler to replace my Invicta battery after purchasing the watch well over MSRP at Zales... And of course Zales discontuned support for the watch due to it's size)... Will definitely be returning! A+ business!

name: Pwncake Ironfarts

name: Kelly Mattos
text:
In mid-late October 2013 I took my watch to the Jewelry and Watch repair center on University. The owner changed my battery and then admitted to me that he had broken the watch crystal (clear glass over watch face). He reassured me that he would fix my watch. He is a liar, thief and con-artist. In the almost two months that they were “fixing” my watch I went 3 times to try to get any information. Finally I just gave up and told them to give me my watch broken. The owner was rude, impolite and intimidating.
Whenever; I informed him that I wanted my watch immediately regardless of the fact that 2 months later it was STILL BROKEN. He said that he had tried to “make it right” and that he had been looking to buy me another watch from EBAY. The watch I have is a limited edition Android Prism watch that is no longer being made. He said that he had been unable to find any watch similar to mine. While I do not watch a watch from EBAY; I would like to point out that in the last 4 minutes I have found over 5 watches currently for sale on EBAY with the exact same crystal. These are not cheap Wal-Mart watches; he simply did not even try to find a similar watch.
The owner stated that since he had been unable to find a similar watch on ebay (lie) that he would have to send the watch out to Las Vegas to have a crystal custom made. If that was the case then why after 2 months was my watch still sitting on the counter? Why had they not already sent it to be fixed?  It does not take 2 months to drive to the post office. It is apparent that they had no plans on trying to fix my watch.
When the watch was originally broken by the owner, it had a tiny chip in the upper right corner. The watch has received even more damage since it has been in their possession. The original chip has spread to 3 times the size along with a new crack on the upper left. The back is covered in DOZENS of scratches and the hands do not seem to be functioning correctly.
The owner did not even try to fix my watch. He did not even offer a replacement. Under no circumstances should anyone ever go to these people. Now all I have is a broken piece of crap, and no way to have it fixed or repaired. They broke my watch and refused to fix it. These people are terrible.

name: Jennifer Osman
text: I went in Pee Wee pawn shop today and my experience was not a good one. I have never in my life had someone treat me the way this employee did. If I knew her name I would absolutely call her out. This was at the Trussville location and there were only two employees that I saw. But it was the woman that happen to be available when I came into the store. She was a straight up ass hole. Rolling her eyes when I asked a question as if it was the dumbest thing she had ever heard.  Or as if I was waisting her time. As I told her what I needed to pawn her attitude towards me was hateful from the start the least she could do is be polite and say that they were not interested in what I was trying to pawn at the time. Instead she said she would maybe give me a dollar for it. As she laughed under her breath. That behavior was so uncalled for. And then when I pointed out something on the clearance table that was still marked 60 dollars she stomped her foot and in a aggrevated tone said ok fine let me see it. Now I understand what she was telling me. And I understand why that product that was similar to mine was on the clearance table because it wasn't  selling well. But none the less it was still worth more than a dollar. But she apparently thought I could not comprehend that because of  her childish body gesture's. What she would not take the time to hear was that I had no intention of letting my item be sold in the store. I just needed to pawn it for a little while because life is not easy sometimes but thanks for making my day a little brighter. I wasn't looking for sympathy when I went in, but is it to much to ask for you to just be polite to someone you don't know.   Finally I said to the woman, " you know what, I haven't done anything to you to deserve such a attitude. I will never be back to this store again." And then she had the audacity to reply with, " good deal you have a great day!" GOOD DEAL!!!! Are you kidding me. If you hate your job that much then go do something else instead of being a jerk to your customers I really don't think the owner would appreciate that at all. I know if I had worked hard enough to open three different location and had all that going the last thing I would want is people walking through my doors to be treated that way. But I didn't act a fool because I have more class than that I just kept walking and took my business to another pawn shop who did let me pawn my item and gave me way more than a dollar for it.

name: Joseph Mogill
text: I brought my watch in to get a new battery. The customer service was friendly, but they were unable to complete the service due to “not having a piece to close the back.” Since it was a “high end” watch, they needed to send it to a company for 2 weeks + $20. Didn’t seem right so I decline and they didn’t charge me for the new battery they gave me. I left with a bag full of watch parts. Later, I realized the gasket was damaged, I was missing parts, and with a battery that doesn’t work. This watch is a standard Tissot, and doesn’t need “special” parts to change out batteries. I will send my business elsewhere.

resp.text:
Hi Joseph.  In the 1000+ Watches we work on yearly, we do occasionally have a watch repair that requires a higher level of service than our on site Watch Repair shop feels comfortable offering. In those instances, we send the watch to our repairman in Texas, whom we have worked with for years, and they will repair and send back to us. The service is excellent and the pricing is very affordable for our customers.

Out of all the watches we have replaced a battery on this year, yours was the only one that we needed to send off for further inspection. The reason was because of a damaged gasket (so it appeared) - but certainly it was beyond our comfort level of repair locally. Rather than continue to work with it locally, we felt the need to move it to a higher tier repairman so that we could offer the best service on your watch. Your response was that you had someone in Georgia who has worked on it before and could put the back on with the gasket, no problem. You seemed as if it was no problem and we assumed that was the case.

It appears that there your repairman in Georgia saw a similar issue that we did - that there was still a problem.   Our repairmen would have had no issue providing the service that was needed to complete the task but I understand that you didn’t feel comfortable with us taking care of the problem for you further. I’m sorry you felt that way.  We certainly do everything we can to provide a level of service that makes people feel comfortable with allowing us to take care of them from start to finish. I believe, as you can see by the reviews, that we have always done our part to make things right and offer a service that ends with satisfaction.  While you may have felt uneasy about letting us finish the repair for you, I do not believe we have any type of reviews or history that would warrant that feeling from you. Instead, I believe it’s just the opposite - that we have a proven record (shown on reviews) of making sure all of our customers are fully satisfied and we work hard to maintain this level of service.

Either way, we are sorry you were unable to do business with us and see our service through to the end. But we wish you all the best.

name: Michelle Whitelaw
text:
I cannot say enough wonderful things about Diamond Depot. I had a loose diamond that I wanted to incorporate into a unique engagement ring. I work in Atlanta, so I decided to visit a well known jewelry designer in Buckhead. She was very knowledgeable, but had her own idea for the ring, and didn’t seem to listen to what I wanted.  Frustrated and disappointed after our third meeting, I decided to scrap the whole project.

When explaining the bad experience to a friend, she mentioned that Terry had recently designed an engagement ring for a relative which turned out beautifully. Since I live in Oxford, I figured I didn’t have anything to lose so I dropped in one day to check it out. During our first meeting, Terry really took the time to listen to me, made notes and offered suggestions when I asked for them.

Over the course of the design process, I completely changed what I wanted, but Terry and Amanda were very patient and encouraging. When I decided that I wanted side stones, they arranged to bring in three sets for me to view with my diamond to find the perfect match.  After I received the original CAD rendering, I realized that there were a few things that I wanted to change. Each suggestion was promptly incorporated into the design and a new CAD rendering sent.

I was able to pick up my finished ring on Christmas Eve, and it was more stunning than I had ever imagined. Even though this was a custom design that involved a lot of personal service, the price for the setting was very reasonable.  I have worked with various jewelers on other projects and I can say without a doubt that Terry and Amanda’s design capabilities and professionalism are the best I’ve experienced. Thank you guys for a beautiful, one-of-a-kind ring!!!

resp.text: Michelle thank you!  I hope you're enjoying that beautiful ring!  If we can help you with anything at all, please let us know!

name: Melissa Allen
text: I will be leaving this review in part for my husband, who never takes the time to do it himself. With that being said, his not leaving a review in no way should be taken as a bad experience. In fact, he was so impressed with his experience, that he struggled with not sharing it too soon. When he gave me the ring he purchased, (which BTW is beautiful) it was as though he was almost as thrilled with being able to share with me how pleased he had been with his experience, as he was with giving me the ring. The knowledge that Amanda used in order to help him to make the right choices, was very helpful. I smile even now, thinking about how impressed he was with the way Diamon Depot operates. I will refrain from going into all the details he shared with me in reference to their Knowledge, professionalism, price, etc. Other than to say, I'm convinced he will never go anywhere else. I can assure you, based on my own experience which consisted of having the ring sized, and having my older band recoated, at Diamond Depot,  if you've never done business here, you are missing out. Again, Thank you Amanda, for all of your help, from beginning to end. You will definitely be seeing us in the future.

text:

She has an awesome personality and was so patient with listening to our needs and wants.   Amanda’s knowledge was also helpful.  We ended up special ordering my ring and could not be happier. Just WOW! LOVE IT!  The Oweners were there as well and adds the nice family atmosphere.   I think it is important to support small local businesses, but We got to do this and get the best service and quality we were looking for.  Their prices and customer service are not beatable.  We have found a local jeweler that we will recommend to anyone! Near or far.
THANK YOU Diamond Depot!
Thank you Amanda, & Terry for all your service!
Don and Marci
